name: Khelcom Farm
description: A black-owned urban farm focusing on diversified vegetables, cut flowers, and herbs. They also sell Senegalese baskets, eggs, and maple syrup. Their farm stand is open mid-May through October
services: Black-owned Crop planning in Vermont consultation

name: Clemmons Family Farm
description: One of the largest and oldest African-American-owned farms in Vermont, it is transitioning to a Black-led non-profit organization. It focuses on sustainable agriculture, food sovereignty, and serves as a cultural heritage asset for the African diaspora. They offer on-farm artist residencies and community-building programming
services: Black-owned Crop planning in Vermont consultation

name: SUSU CommUNITY Farm
description: An Afro-Indigenous stewarded farm and land-based healing center in Southern Vermont, created to offer life-affirming spaces for Black, Indigenous, and People of Color. They focus on food and land sovereignty through educational opportunities and ancestral healing
services: Black-owned Crop planning in Vermont consultation

name: Black Dirt Farm
address: Northeast Kingdom, Vermont (specific address not provided)
description: A diversified family farm in Vermont's Northeast Kingdom that practices regenerative agriculture. They collect food scraps for composting and worm castings to nourish their soils and crops. They offer pasture-raised eggs, meat birds, garden compost, and worm castings
services: Black-owned Crop planning in Vermont consultation

name: Rose Wilson Consulting LLC
address: United States (specific Vermont address not provided)
description: While not exclusively a crop planning business, Rose Wilson Consulting offers business and strategic planning services for farms and food producers, including market development and grant writing. She has worked with numerous farms in Vermont
services: Black-owned Crop planning in Vermont consultation
